SEARCH
Package Models

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Models.Player
public class Player extends Object
Player represents a player in the game, managing identity, game state, inventory, and game statistics. Each player has a character type, current position on the game map, remaining moves, and an inventory for collecting items. The class tracks comprehensive game statistics including moves, questions answered, items collected, and special item usage throughout the game session.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String name, Room startRoom, boolean isBot, String characterType)
      Creates a new Player with the specified name, starting room, bot status, and character type. Initializes the player's inventory, path tracking, and all statistics counters to zero. If the player name exceeds the maximum length, it is truncated to fit the limit.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the player (truncated if exceeds max length)
      startRoom - the initial room where the player begins
      isBot - true if this is an AI-controlled player, false if human-controlled
      characterType - the character type for visual representation

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of this player.
      Returns:
      the player's name

    • isBot

      public boolean isBot()
      Returns whether this player is controlled by the computer.
      Returns:
      true if this is a bot player, false if human-controlled

    • getCharacterType

      public String getCharacterType()
      Returns the character type of this player.
      Returns:
      the character type for visual representation

    • getCurrentRoom

      public Room getCurrentRoom()
      Returns the room this player is currently in.
      Returns:
      the player's current room

    • setCurrentRoom

      public void setCurrentRoom(Room currentRoom)
      Sets the player's current room to the specified room.
      Parameters:
      currentRoom - the room to set as the player's current location

    • getMoves

      public int getMoves()
      Returns the number of remaining moves for this player.
      Returns:
      the remaining movement points

    • setMoves

      public void setMoves(int moves)
      Sets the number of remaining moves for this player.
      Parameters:
      moves - the number of movement points to set

    • getLastDirection

      public String getLastDirection()
      Returns the last direction the player moved.
      Returns:
      the last movement direction as a string

    • setLastDirection

      public void setLastDirection(String direction)
      Sets the last direction the player moved.
      Parameters:
      direction - the movement direction to set

    • moveTaken

      public void moveTaken()
      Decrements the remaining moves by one and increments the total moves counter. Only decreases remaining moves if the player has moves available.

    • getInventory

      public ArrayUnorderedList<Item> getInventory()
      Returns the player's inventory list.
      Returns:
      the ArrayUnorderedList containing the player's items

    • addItem

      public boolean addItem(Item item)
      Adds an item to the player's inventory if there is space available. The inventory can hold a maximum of 3 items.
      Parameters:
      item - the item to add to the inventory
      Returns:
      true if the item was successfully added, false if inventory is full

    • useItem

      public Item useItem(int index)
      Removes and returns the item at the specified index from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the item to remove
      Returns:
      the item that was removed, or null if index is out of bounds

    • getItem

      public Item getItem(int index)
      Returns the item at the specified index without removing it from the inventory.
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the item to retrieve
      Returns:
      the item at the specified index, or null if index is out of bounds

    • addPickaxe

      public void addPickaxe()
      Adds a pickaxe item to the player's inventory.

    • usePickaxe

      public void usePickaxe()
      Removes a pickaxe from the player's inventory by searching for the first item with the name "Pickaxe" and removing it.

    • getPickaxeCount

      public int getPickaxeCount()
      Returns the count of pickaxes currently in the player's inventory.
      Returns:
      the number of pickaxes in the inventory

      Parameters:
      room - the room to add to the path

    • getPath

      Returns the complete path of rooms visited by this player.
      Returns:
      the ArrayUnorderedList containing all rooms in the player's path
